frameDefinitions: An Experiencer feels bad about a choice, an Action, or a failure to do something, which they now consider to have been a mistake or wrong.
A Cognizer takes a certain Expectation to be a reliable fact, such that their plans can be based on it.
An Agent matches location with an Entity in order to fulfill some  Purpose.
This frame contains words referring to teaching and the participants in teaching.
An Agent wants to achieve a Goal,  or an object.
frameExamples: Smithers did not <t>repent</t> of his crime.
I can always <t>count</t> <t>on</t> him being late to work when it's raining.
I ca n't remember how many times he <t>visited</t> ! DNI
Dad <t>taught</t> me that if you work hard, you will be OK - no matter what happens.
The modest American <t>goal</t> of a threefold increase in capacity recognises this fact .
listRoleDefinitions: A force, process, or event that produces an effect.
Agents in a joint or reciprocal action (e.g. exchange)
A positive or negative evaluation of the Phenomenon.
An entity which participates in a <fen>Cause</fen>, perhaps volitionally and perhaps not.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the event occurs.
Where the event takes place.
The role <fen>Experiencer</fen> indicates the person who experiences the emotion about their prior action.
The role <fen>Action</fen> marks expressions that indicate a prior action that the <fen>Experiencer</fen> has come to feel bad about.
The role <fen>Expressor</fen> marks expressions that indicate a gesture or body part which is displaying the <fen>Emotional_state</fen> of the <fen>Experiencer</fen>.
The role <fen>Emotional_state</fen> is modified by an adjective  that indicates the <fen>Experiencer</fen> is contrite.
The <fen>Time</fen> at which the <fen>Experiencer</fen> or the <fen>Expressor</fen> is contrite.
An individual that considers the Expectation certain.
The fact which the <fen>Cognizer</fen> depends on in planning for the future.
The sentient entity that is temporarily with the <fen>Entity</fen> in order to fulfil some <fen>Purpose</fen>.

The physical entity that is permanently associated with entities or characteristics that the <fen>Agent</fen> wishes to use for some <fen>Purpose</fen>.  During the visit, the <fen>Agent</fen> matches location with the <fen>Entity</fen>.
The time at which a visit is made.
A description of the position of the <fen>Agent</fen> during the visit.
One who instructs a <fen>Student</fen> in some area of knowledge or skill.
One who is instructed by a <fen>Teacher</fen> in skills or knowledge.
An educational establishment, such as a school or college.
The area of knowledge or skill which is taught by a <fen>Teacher</fen> or to a <fen>Student</fen>.
A formal Qualification such as an academic degree or a certificate for which a student is aiming.
An action which the <fen>Student</fen> is able to perform as a result of instruction.
A guideline for correct behavior. In most cases, this concerns morally or socially desirable actions.
A piece of information that the <fen>Student</fen> is informed of by the <fen>Teacher</fen>.
Educational <fen>Material</fen>, such as books, tapes, or videos, used by a <fen>Teacher</fen> or a <fen>Student</fen> to acquire skills or knowledge.
A role, typically professional or vocational,  that the <fen>Student</fen> is meant to be able to fill as a result of their training.
FN: a program of lectures or other matter dealing with a subject
The time when the teaching occurs.

The <fen>Place</fen> is the location within which the teaching takes place.

Consider whether a possible <fen>Place</fen> phrase is really where the training took place or is rather part of a description of the <fen>Institution</fen>.
The volitional actor who intends to achieve a goal.
The action or state of affairs that the Agent wants to achieve.
A <fen>Means</fen> is an object or action that is used or designed to achieve a particular <fen>Goal</fen>.
This role marks expressions that indicate an <fen>Attribute</fen> for which it is the <fen>Agent</fen>'s goal that it have or reach a particular <fen>Value</fen> .
This role marks expressions that indicate which <fen>Value</fen> the <fen>Agent</fen> wants the <fen>Attribute</fen> to reach.
This Frame Element expresses a time period during which an <fen>Agent</fen> had a particular <fen>Goal</fen>.
listRoleExamples: <fex>The wind</fex> made the door rattle.
<fex>That one stone</fex>, apparently, caused the avalanche that engulfed square miles of forest.
<fex>Smithers</fex> was contrite about his wrongdoings.
They confessed and repented <fex>their actions against the Soviet Union</fex>.
Repentant <fex>tears</fex> welled to his eyes.
Martha had a guilty <fex>conscience</fex> after selling inferior merchandise.
I think you should count <fex>on getting a paycut</fex>.
She's a <fex>French</fex> Teacher
She's Studying <fex>for a Master's degree</fex>
Taut with worry, Dad taught us <fex>how to drive</fex>.
My brother taught me <fex>not to be mean to guys when I'm not interested in them</fex>.
When I was two she taught me <fex>that a quarter was 25 cents and a dime was 10 cents</fex>.
All employees have received <fex>a booklet</fex> INSTRUCTING them on how to report ` anything from unwanted touching and uncalled-for blue jokes to overt demands for sexual favours . '
When his father died he went to live with an uncle in Ka'u who trained him <fex>as a warrior</fex> during his teenage years
<fex>Microsoft 's</fex> goal of delivering a million copies in the first year is trifling compared to the 25 million copies of Windows it has shipped since May 1990.
The company missed its goal <fex>of getting a thousand third-party software packages shipped</fex>.
The goal <fex>of treatment</fex> was to lower diastolic blood pressure below 85 mm  Hg .
We exceeded our <fex>production</fex> target of 2000 units
GM has a production target <fex>of 2,000,000 units</fex>
But the main goal <fex>of the 1990s</fex> could be to transform a big , heavily armed standing army into a more flexible force
